alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Ida; Plymouth; Woodbury (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 05 at 7:23PM CDT until August 05 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Cherokee County in northwestern Iowa... Northeastern Woodbury County in west central Iowa... Southeastern Plymouth County in northwestern Iowa... Northwestern Ida County in west central Iowa... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 723 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Washta, or 14 miles southwest of Cherokee, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Quimby and Washta around 730 PM CDT. Holstein around 745 PM CDT. Cushing around 750 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Iowa.
